meanings.definition: To give a new surface to (wood, metal, etc.) by applying a finish again or repairing the old one.
meanings.sent1: I refinished the old table by sanding it down and applying a fresh coat of varnish.
meanings.sent2: The carpenter refinished the antique dresser to restore its beauty.
meanings.sent3: After I refinished the chair, it looked so shiny that it seemed to sparkle.
meanings.sent4: She refinished the rusty gate, turning it into a gleaming piece of art.
meanings.sent5: The refinished desk gleamed under the sunlight, showcasing its renewed elegance.

meanings.definition: To improve or repair (something) by making it look new again.
meanings.sent1: The painter refinished the faded walls with a fresh coat of paint.
meanings.sent2: They refinished the scratched floor to make it smooth and shiny.
meanings.sent3: The refinished bicycle looked so new that it fooled everyone into thinking it was brand new.
meanings.sent4: Her smile refinished the gloomy room, brightening up the atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The refinished car sparkled in the sunlight, attracting admiring glances from passersby.
